content.label: This used to be a great game until it got bought out. Never any updates to fix the bugs. Wasn’t exactly a cheap app either. Just took our money and ran. Too bad. Still fun to play but the bugs and resulting scoring mistakes make me regret having ever purchased it. Lesson learned.

There are several issues with this game and I just downloaded it. The game uses about 80% of my screen. The letters and units are almost illegible. Tried following link for support and it doesn't go anywhere.

I can’t read the rules because they are cut off on the side of the screen. This sis the same for the history section as well. It’s a shame. I enjoy the game but am unable to enjoy all of its features.

title.label: New update buggy & with some bad design decisions

content.label: The previous version of this game was one of the all-time best , indeed almost perfect, wargames on iPad on any other platform. This new update, which comes after the original game studio was bought by Slitherine, has some serious problems. Within 5-10 mins of play I noticed that the graphics seemed unstable with occasional sudden weird glitches such as screen shaking. The beautiful amazing elegant sound design of the original game has been messed with and spoiled e.g. with machine gun fire which is loud and goes on for far too long . There are interface formatting glitches not present in the original. And most alarming of all there I found what appears to be a major rule change (I hope it is a bug...) from the original - the change is about movement in the first couple of turns - the AI carried out 3 space strategic movement out of a contested zone !
The text is unnecessarily tiny, all but impossible to read, and some of it cut off by the edge of the screen.  This is clearly and iPad game and shouldn’t be sold as working on an iPhone.

This was an absolute waste of $10.00 I fell into the trap of these good reviews which were probably put there by developers and people with a vested interest in the app. It is a rudimentary and basic turned based 2D map strategy game where you can get even better ones for free in the App Store. DONT WATE YOUR MONEY ON THIS GAME!!!!!

I bought this game along with 2 other games they put out in a bundle. One called MOSCOW & the other called DESERT FOX. I’ve tried unsuccessfully to update my purchases but I cannot. Seems the developer didn't update so the games are worthless. BEWARE this game may too get abandoned after you pay. I would rate it no stars cuz I feel ripped off- LOSERS
The app determines when the game play is over which is rather annoying. I should be able to continue gameplay irrespective of the presupposed outcome.
As an old Avalon Hill fan, I love the fact that the game has real tabletop rules that you can follow and understand.

Pros:  The history of the battle and the accuracy of the game
Cons:  boring. Move your pieces to a space with a bridge and then just pass every turn. Very heavily weighted for the defenders. Any offensive movements end in stalemates. I thought it was something wrong that I was doing so I watched the very few YouTube videos that show how to win and most of them lose or end up in a stalemate.  Not sure why someone would post a YouTube video showing them losing but that’s pretty much standard for the game if you play the axis.  Save your money and read the Wikipedia page on Battle of the Bulge
Fun so far but there doesn’t seem to be any means of closing out the history screen during the first battle scenario. One must close the app and restart it.

This is one of my favorites. I am close to 500 hours on it. It is easy to learn but hard to be good at. Play the AI till you think you are competent or even good. Then play against other players and you will go to a whole new level. The games play quickly and you have many scenarios to choose from. Well worth the few dollars to buy. See you online!

title.label: The BEST war game in the App Store

content.label: For war gamers, this is the BEST game app in the App Store.  WELL worth the purchase price.  Easy to play, but still complex enough to be challenging. I play against other players from all over the world.  The straight-up "Battle of the Bulge" scenario works well.   Unfortunately, the "Luck of the Draw" scenario doesn't work online, but the "Endgame" version does, and is a very challenging scenario.  For new players - play against the AI for a bit, and then challenge or accept a challenge against another player. Hugely rewarding and fun!

So I finally switched to the new version as not many were left to play the original.  Plays better than the initial reviews.  AI has been lobotomized, I just surrounded about 10 divisions.  Much more difficult to understand multiplayer system compared to original Game Center. I will say that once you figure out the multiplayer, there are a lot of good players online. Let's hope they improve the AI for the next update.

title.label: Would give the update no stars if possible...

content.label:
So, they took a game that played great on phones and tablets and then shredded it o make it Windows and Mac compatible...
There are tons of games better suited to the pc/Mac environment. Destroying the tablet/phone playability of this game to make it run on those platforms is, well, stupid.
Also, the new multi-player interface is a definite downgrade from Game Center.
This game has been ruined! Save your $10!

title.label: I love it, for me: perfect!

content.label:
I just got this three days ago and no major issues or glitches running on a newer model iPad mini.  It's very easy to learn yet deep to play, which is ideal for me.  It's not overly complex, perfect for a more casual wargamer but might be too simple for the hardcore wargamer who's used to 20-page rule books.  I play solo against AI and find it very enjoyable, addictive more like it.  No experience with multi-player to comment on.  I am hooked and am going to pick up the Moscow version next.  
Cheers
New update makes AI worthless, the game ugly, the feel and sound are not what they used to be. Sometimes the menus won't even work. All for what?

What a mess!  Online multiplayer is awful, no turn alerts on the app instead you get an email, great, as if I need more spam to sort through.  Consequently it takes hours or days for a turn to take place, not a day, a turn. The older version was much better. The instructions are not very helpful and customer support does NOT get back to you. RIPOFF!

This update ruined the game.  The sound doesn't work, map zoom is weird, and the entire motion and action of everything is choppy and staccato like.  Used to be perfect and beautiful in all regards, worth the money. Now it's a piece of garbage.  Just revert a few versions back and I won't hate you anymore.

I have this game on an iPad 2. Since the update of December 9, I haven't been able to complete a single game. I've been trying to play "The Bitter End" and the game freezes during the AI movement or reinforcement phase. This happens every time.
Definitely not worth the purchase price for new users.
Difficult to understand. The help menu need better instruction on unit movement.

The latest version still relies on the clumsy play-by-email solution. Multi-player is painfully slow and irritating enough that you just want games to end. Graphics and motion don't render cleanly. There are multiple game rules bugs involving movement, retreat, armor exploit, road function, British unit early movement, and score keeping.

The last update fixed the impermissible lag, and the game functions just as amazingly as it did before.

iPad 3, latest iOS as of this post.

Slitherin took over Shenandoah and sabotaged their formerly 5 star game.

Would really like a refund for what is now a stinking pile of garbage

This was the kind of update that brings to mind the word refund.
Who let this mess out the door at Shenandoah?
This was an awesome game, after the update, it now freezes up when it is the computer's turn to move.  Very disappointing. How do I get a refund?

This used to be one of the best War Strategy games out there. Now you can't even complete a game without it bogging down and then freezing up. Whoever ok'd something this incompetent should be fired. Don't buy this game until it get's fixed.
This was a great game. But this new version has broken it on the iPhone.
Easily a 5 star game before the "update" which shoehorned a PC interface onto a mobile game and riddled the game with bugs making the multiplayer portion completely unplayable for me.
So much for the vaunted multiplayer additions. NOwhere to even have your password reset!
Hey, thanks for taking a five star game down to one. You should work for the US Government now. I'll make sure not to update Drive on  Moscow or Desert Fox until you fix BB.
Wow, with the update they managed to ruin a game that I had previously enjoyed.

The latest update to this wonderful game is so debilitating it motivated me to write my first iOS review.  What was a top-notch wargame has been reduced to a glitchy mess that's three times as slow.  I've seen some questionable app updates before, but never one so comprehensively poor.  Do not buy or update until fixed.

I knew when Shenandoah Studio was forced to sell out to Slitherine that this would end badly for this series of games. Bulge is the first casualty. Drive on Moscow and Desert Fox will be next. Have already deleted Bulge. Sad.

No sound in my app on ipad, works on iphone. I've checked all settings, deleted and re-downloaded, etc.  I e-mailed support 4 weeks ago and have not yet received reply, so my review gets posted.  Sad that they take my money for a defective product and there's no recourse.  That's why I'm reluctant to purchase apps for more than a dollar or 2.

title.label: How to ruin a great game

content.label:
This was the game that brought serious wargaming to the iPad. This was the model of how good a new platform could be and how to leverage that.

For inexplicable reasons, Slitherine took this marvel and re-wrote it as total junk.

If you saved your pre 2.0 version, good for you. I wish I had.

This was a great game.  I have it both on my iPhone and iPad.  I gave the original a great review! I don't want to repeat what others have said about this latest version 2.14 and gave it a one or two rating.  Yeah I thought I had a bad download at first.  It's not your iPhone or iPad.  It's the version 2.14.  Keep the original version until they fix this!

The previous version of this game was spectacular, but this "upgrade" is a miserable buggy failure. I have experienced all manner of bugs including hangs, rules bugs, interface issues, and more. Thankfully I did not — and will not — upgrade this game on my iPad.

title.label: Don't Trust the Nay Sayers ! Excellent Update

content.label: I have an iPad and can say that the game is working great. My condolences to those with lesser devices ... But if you have an iPad, this game now has PC style save slots and is cross platform. Nice work Devs and Slitherine !

Combat preview windows are difficult to read on iPhone. "Continue" feature is broken, at least in luck of the draw. AI play is slower. Rule change for isolated units? They lose strength points with no enemy units in space. This game used to be a 5-star game.

title.label: Sleek, smart and fun until the new update happened.

content.label:
The new update is really clunky, slow, and with no obvious benefit over the original. The devs should have spent more time testing and tweaking. Completely ruined the game. I wish there was a way to revert to the original version. 

This was my 5-star review before the update:

This is perhaps a model of how iPad turn-based war games should look and feel -- there is a lot to like about this game. Looks great, plays well, incorporates the iPad touch screen brilliantly into gameplay. The beauty of this game is how it managed to simplify very complex concepts and variables but still provides a deep and nuanced experience. The only downside to this game: the AI is fairly easy to beat. There are no difficulty levels and I wish gameplay actually lasted a bit longer, it seems to be over before it began, but that's probably because time flies when you're having fun! Flip side: Multiplayer is fun and challenging.

Looking forward to see what this studio comes up with next!

The update pushed in September of 2015 absolutely ruined this game. 

The developer basically shoehorned a version re-written for the PC onto iOS. The controls are too small to use, there's no good use of touch, and all interface elements are better suited to a PC screen than to an iPhone 6. 

This horrible "update" is only mitigated by the fact that the new bugs introduced in this build make the game itself unplayable, as you cannot even scroll to see your troops in some modes. Thanks for that at least. 

The part that really bites is that these guys had to know this update was going to wreck the game on iPhones, from the interface changes alone. They shipped it anyway. 

I'll be seeking a refund.

I remember as a kid when a cereal advertised new and improved, that was the last time I ate that cereal. 

The improvements to the game consist of an improved and more intelligent AI.  This would be great if the interface was readable (iPhone 5s) but it is so microscopic I just avoid it.  The movement of units is much clunkier as is the ability to undo moves.  Further, the speed of play, that is the ability to process moves has greatly increased.  So what had been a game that it was possible to enjoy in a short period of time has become as interminable as playing a live opponent suffering from AP.

Do not update to this version!

The game appears to have been replaced with a version written with a common code base to the Windows and Mac version.  Everything that was so great about this title is diminished.

The new fonts are awful.  The sounds are irritating.  What was once beautifully flowing animation is now jerky on my Air 2.  The game has also become slow.  What used to be fast and fluid is now a real dog.  This went from being a great iPad game to being a terrible port of the computer version.

The new AI is a disaster.  As the Axis, it went defensive without securing enough VP locations to have a chance to win.  This made for very boring play.  To make matters worse, there is no longer an option to continue a game once one side wins.  That used to lead to some interesting gameplay, and it's now just gone.

There also appear to be problems with the rules of the game not being properly implemented.  From Axis strategic movement on the first turn to units that are isolated (yellow) retreating, proper care and attention wasn't used in creating this new version.

I want my old game back!

I loved this game! Played it all the time … perfect length game to make me forgot about 45 minutes on the treadmill. But this update is bad. The game is slower, the menu redesigns are bad, and the buttons are ridiculously small. I want my old version back. :-(

Having been a Kickstarter supporter from the earliest days and two years without an update I expected more. Their are small improvements in some areas but the AI may have been rewritten but is know smarter. The screen is refined on the iPad but the text is too small. The movement sound effects stop after the first 'square'. Movement after victory with one armor and infantry displays a message that you haven't moved all your units after you moved your tanks. I could go on.

title.label: A formerly great game screwed up

content.label: I previously wrote a very positive review when this game came out, but wow are the changes annoying. Slower (even on the iPhone 6), smaller harder to read menus, screwed up in game menus, and worst of all there is no password retrieval feature. This game really got the Al Alamein treatment. I guess their new publisher really is a soulless war gaming giant that spits out crappy war games. Sorry guys. I really thought this would breathe some new life into this game but left disappointed.

I don't know what I expected, but it was more than this. The graphics are sort of childlike, the maps aren't really maps, and the movement is clunky.

I am old enough (sadly) to have played, and loved the one Avalon Hill board war games.

They achieved more with fold out boards and die cut cardboard playing prices than this game.
10$ for one map? Do I lack brain? I want my money back I must be stupid since I play on one map for 10 minutes and then game over.
